"!")                                                                   | [@](/wiki/@ "@")                                                                   | [#](/wiki/Hash_mark "Hash mark")                                                   | [$](/wiki/$ "$")                                                                   | [%](/wiki/%25 "%")                                                                 | [^](/wiki/%5E "^") | [&](/wiki/%26 "&") | [\*](/wiki/* "*") | [(](/wiki/\( "(")    | [)](/wiki/\) ")")        | [\_](/wiki/Underscore "Underscore") | [+](/wiki/Plus_sign "Plus sign") |              [space](/wiki/Space "Space")             |                                                         |                                   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |
| [\`](/wiki/%60 "`")                               | [1](/wiki/Numbers_used_in_the_warning_system "Numbers used in the warning system") | [2](/wiki/Numbers_used_in_the_warning_system "Numbers used in the warning system") | [3](/wiki/Numbers_used_in_the_warning_system "Numbers used in the warning system") | [4](/wiki/Numbers_used_in_the_warning_system "Numbers used in the warning system") | [5](/wiki/Numbers_used_in_the_warning_system "Numbers used in the warning system") | [6](/wiki/6 "6")   | [7](/wiki/7 "7")   | [8](/wiki/8 "8")  | [9](/wiki/9 "9")     | [0](/wiki/0 "0")         | [-](/wiki/- "-")                    | [=](/wiki/%3D "=")               |   [{](/wiki/Left_curly_bracket "Left curly bracket")  | [}](/wiki/Right_curly_bracket "Right curly bracket")    | [\|](/wiki/Pipe "Pipe")           |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |
|                                                   | [Qq](/wiki/Q "Q")                                                                  | [Ww](/wiki/W "W")                                                                  | [Ee](/wiki/E "E")                                                                  | [Rr](/wiki/R "R")                                                                  | [Tt](/wiki/T "T")                                                                  | [Yy](/wiki/Y "Y")  | [Uu](/wiki/U "U")  | [Ii](/wiki/I "I") | [Oo](/wiki/O "O")    | [Pp](/wiki/P "P")        | [:](/wiki/Colon "Colon")            | ["](/wiki/%22 "\"")              | [\[](/wiki/Left_square_bracket "Left square bracket") | [\]](/wiki/Right_square_bracket "Right square bracket") | [\\](/wiki/Backslash "Backslash") |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |
|                                                   | [Aa](/wiki/A "A")                                                                  | [Ss](/wiki/S "S")                                                                  | [Dd](/wiki/D "D")                                                                  | [Ff](/wiki/F "F")                                                                  | [Gg](/wiki/G "G")                                                                  | [Hh](/wiki/H "H")  | [Jj](/wiki/J "J")  | [Kk](/wiki/K "K") | [Ll](/wiki/L "L")    | [?](/wiki/%3F "?")       | [;](/wiki/; ";")                    | ['](/wiki/%27 "'")               |               [Ctrl](/wiki/Ctrl "Ctrl")               |                                                         |                                   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |
|                                                   | [Zz](/wiki/Z "Z")                                                                  | [Xx](/wiki/X "X")                                                                  | [Cc](/wiki/C "C")                                                                  | [Vv](/wiki/V "V")                                                                  | [Bb](/wiki/B "B")                                                                  | [Nn](/wiki/N "N")  | [Mm](/wiki/M "M")  | [,](/wiki/, ",")  | [.](/wiki/Dot "Dot") | [/](/wiki/Slash "Slash") | [<]()                               | [>]()                            |                 [Alt](/wiki/Alt "Alt")                |                                                         |                                   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |

- <, >, < and > represent [staircases](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase") and [ladders](/wiki/Ladder "Ladder"). The gray characters are stairs and the brown ones ladders; the brackets pointing left lead upwards, those that point right lead downwards.
- Press **[<]()** or **[>]()** to go up or down a staircase or ladder, or down into a [hole](/wiki/Hole "Hole") or [trap door](/wiki/Trap_door "Trap door") you avoided. When asked for a direction, such as when applying a [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") or zapping a [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand"), use these keys to direct your action up or down.
- Press **[<]()** or **[>]()** to [go back or forward](/wiki/Menu_controls "Menu controls") one page in a multi-page menu. This is supported by [tty](/wiki/Tty "Tty") and [curses interfaces](/wiki/Curses_interface "Curses interface"); see [Menu controls](/wiki/Menu_controls "Menu controls").

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Angle bracket

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt
  • <, >, < and > represent staircases and ladders. The gray characters are stairs and the brown ones ladders; the brackets pointing left lead upwards, those that point right lead downwards.
  • Press < or > to go up or down a staircase or ladder, or down into a hole or trap door you avoided. When asked for a direction, such as when applying a pick-axe or zapping a wand, use these keys to direct your action up or down.
  • Press < or > to go back or forward one page in a multi-page menu. This is supported by tty and curses interfaces; see Menu controls.

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.4.3. Information on this page may be out of date.

Editors: After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
